title: Preston Spending: Year-by-Year Trends and What They Reveal
summary: Preston City Council's spending increased by £32.0M (238.9%) from 2019 to 2025, with a total spend of £205.9M across 46,711 transactions.
author: Preston Council Transparency

title: Red Flags in Preston's Spending: What DOGE Analysis Found
summary: The total spend analysed from Preston City Council's published spending records is £205.9M.
author: Preston Council Transparency

title: Inside Preston's Departments: Where Every Pound Goes
summary: The CAP DEVELOPMENT department has received the largest allocation of funds, with a total of £43.9M, accounting for 21.3% of the total spend.
author: Preston Council Transparency

title: Where Preston's Money Really Goes: Top Supplier Analysis 2026
summary: The top 5 suppliers to Preston City Council account for £82.2M, which is 39.9% of the total spend.
author: Preston Council Transparency

title: Preston City Council: £205 Million and the Maple Grove Question
summary: 46,711 transactions across seven years reveal a council with strong procurement controls — just £41,800 in split payments — but one supplier, Maple Grove Developments, takes 15.4% of total spend.
author: Preston Council Transparency
